narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

reporting_org.name: reporting_org
reporting_org.label: reporting-org
reporting_org.hover_text: The organisation issuing the report. May be a primary source (reporting on its own activity as donor, implementing agency, etc) or a secondary source (reporting on the activities of another organisation). For more information

ref.name: ref
ref.label: @ref
ref.hover_text: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. Must be in the format {RegistrationAgency}-{RegistrationNumber}. For more information

type.name: type
type.label: @type
type.hover_text: The type of organisation issuing the report. For more information

secondary_reporter.name: secondary_reporter
secondary_reporter.label: @secondary-reporter
secondary_reporter.hover_text: A flag indicating that the reporting organisation of this activity is acting as a secondary reporter. A secondary reporter is one that reproduces data on the activities of an organisation for which it is not directly responsible. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

lang.name: language
lang.label: @xml:lang
lang.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

reference.name: reference
reference.label: @ref
reference.hover_text: The identifier you wish to report. This can be used to report a number of different types of identifiers. See the OtherIdentifierType codelist for details and options. This attribute is required. For more information

reference_type.name: reference_type
reference_type.label: @type
reference_type.hover_text: The type of identifier being reported, taken from the OtherIdentifierType codelist. This attribute is required. For more information

ref.name: ref
ref.label: @ref
ref.hover_text: Where applicable, the organisation that owns the other identifier being reported. When used, then either other-identifier/owner-org/@ref or other-identifier/owner-org/narrative/text() MUST be present. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

type.name: type
type.label: @type
type.hover_text:
Activity description types. (General, objectives, etc)
Following are the description types:
1. General - Unstructured, long description of the activity
2. Objectives - Specific objectives for the activity, e.g. taken from logical framework
3. Target Groups - Details of groups that are intended to benefit from the activity
4. Other - For miscellaneous use. A further classification or breakdown may be included in the narrative.
For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

activity_status.name: activity_status
activity_status.label: @code
activity_status.hover_text: An IATI code defining the current status of the activity. This attribute is required. For more information

type.name: type
type.label: @type
type.hover_text: An IATI code defining the type of activity date being reported. This attribute is required. For more information

date.name: date
date.label: @iso-date
date.hover_text:
This attribute is required. This value must be of type xsd:date.
11.1.2: The planned start date of the activity must be before the planned end date.
11.1.3: The actual start date of the activity must be before the actual end date.
11.1.4: The actual start date of the activity must not be in the future.
11.1.5: The actual end date of the activity must not be in the future. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

activity_scope.name: activity_scope
activity_scope.label: @code
activity_scope.hover_text: The geographical scope. See IATI codelist for values.This attribute is required.This value must be of type xsd:string. For more information

country_code.name: country_code
country_code.label: @code
country_code.hover_text: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code for the country. This attribute is required. For more information

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.label: @percentage
percentage.hover_text: The percentage of total commitments or total activity budget to this item. Content must be a decimal number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign. Percentages for all reported countries and regions within a vocabulary MUST add up to 100. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

region_vocabulary.name: region_vocabulary
region_vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
region_vocabulary.hover_text: An IATI code for the vocabulary from which the region code is drawn. If it is not present 1 - ‘OECD DAC’ is assumed. For more information

region_code.name: region_code
region_code.label: @code
region_code.hover_text: Either an OECD DAC or UN region code. Codelist is determined by vocabulary attribute. For more information

custom_code.name: custom_code
custom_code.label: @code
custom_code.hover_text: Either an OECD DAC or UN region code. Codelist is determined by vocabulary attribute. For more information

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: @vocabulary-uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

sector_vocabulary.name: sector_vocabulary
sector_vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
sector_vocabulary.hover_text: An IATI code for the vocabulary (see codelist) used for sector classifications. If omitted, OECD DAC 5-digit Purpose Codes are assumed. It is recommended that OECD DAC 5-digit Purpose Codes are used wherever possible. It is also recommended that if a publisher has its own classification system or systems then the vocabularies 99 or 98 (Reporting Organisation’s own vocabularies) should be used in addition to DAC codes. For more information

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: @vocabulary-uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 or 98 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. While this is an optional field it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that all publishers use it to ensure that the meaning of their codes are fully understood by data users. For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: The code for the sector. This attribute is required. For more information

text.name: text
text.label: @code
text.hover_text: The code for the sector. This attribute is required. For more information

category_code.name: category_code
category_code.label: @code
category_code.hover_text: The code for the sector. This attribute is required. For more information

sdg_goal.name: sdg_goal
sdg_goal.label: @code
sdg_goal.hover_text: The code for the sector. This attribute is required. For more information

sdg_target.name: sdg_target
sdg_target.label: @code
sdg_target.hover_text: The code for the sector. This attribute is required. For more information

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.label: @percentage
percentage.hover_text: The percentage of total commitments or total activity budget to this item. Content must be a decimal number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign. All reported sectors from the same vocabulary MUST add up to 100. For more information

narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

tag_vocabulary.name: tag_vocabulary
tag_vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
tag_vocabulary.hover_text: An IATI code for the vocabulary or taxonomy (see non-embedded codelist) used for tag classifications. For more information

goals_tag_code.name: goals_tag_code
goals_tag_code.label: @code
goals_tag_code.hover_text: The code for the tag as defined in the specified vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

targets_tag_code.name: targets_tag_code
targets_tag_code.label: @code
targets_tag_code.hover_text: The code for the tag as defined in the specified vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

tag_text.name: tag_text
tag_text.label: @code
tag_text.hover_text: The code for the tag as defined in the specified vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: @vocabulary-uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

policy_marker_vocabulary.name: policy_marker_vocabulary
policy_marker_vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
policy_marker_vocabulary.hover_text: An IATI code for the vocabulary to be used to define policy markers. If omitted then the OECD DAC vocabulary is assumed. For more information

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: @vocabulary-uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: If the vocabulary is 99 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. For more information

significance.name: significance
significance.label: @significance
significance.hover_text: An OECD DAC CRS code indicating the significance of the policy marker for this activity. This attribute MUST be used for all OECD DAC CRS vocabularies. For more information

policy_marker.name: policy_marker
policy_marker.label: @code
policy_marker.hover_text: A policy marker code from the codelist specified in the vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

policy_marker_text.name: policy_marker_text
policy_marker_text.label: @code
policy_marker_text.hover_text: A policy marker code from the codelist specified in the vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

collaboration_type.name: collaboration_type
collaboration_type.label: @code
collaboration_type.hover_text: A code from the OECD DAC CRS “Bi_Multi” codelist. For more information

default_flow_type.name: default_flow_type
default_flow_type.label: @code
default_flow_type.hover_text: A code from the OECD DAC CRS “Type of flow” codelist. This attribute is required. For more information

default_finance_type.name: default_finance_type
default_finance_type.label: @code
default_finance_type.hover_text: A code from the OECD DAC CRS “Type of finance” codelist. This attribute is required. For more information

default_aid_type_vocabulary.name: default_aid_type_vocabulary
default_aid_type_vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
default_aid_type_vocabulary.hover_text: A code for the vocabulary aid-type classifications. If omitted the AidType (OECD DAC) codelist is assumed. The code must be a valid value in the AidTypeVocabulary codelist. For more information

default_aid_type.name: default_aid_type
default_aid_type.label: @code
default_aid_type.hover_text: A code from the specified vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

earmarking_category.name: earmarking_category
earmarking_category.label: @code
earmarking_category.hover_text: A code from the specified vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

earmarking_modality.name: earmarking_modality
earmarking_modality.label: @code
earmarking_modality.hover_text: A code from the specified vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

cash_and_voucher_modalities.name: cash_and_voucher_modalities
cash_and_voucher_modalities.label: @code
cash_and_voucher_modalities.hover_text: A code from the specified vocabulary. This attribute is required. For more information

default_tied_status.name: default_tied_status
default_tied_status.label: @code
default_tied_status.hover_text: An IATI code interpreting the usage of Columns 36-38 of the CRS++ reporting format. (Amount tied, Amount partially untied, Amount tied). For more information

country_budget_vocabulary.name: country_budget_vocabulary
country_budget_vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
country_budget_vocabulary.hover_text: An IATI code for the common functional classification or country system (This allows for common codes, country-specific, or any other classification agreed between countries and donors). For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: A code for the budget-item from the vocabulary specified. This attribute is required. For more information

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.label: @percentage
percentage.hover_text: When multiple budget-item elements are declared within a single country-budget-items element, then, for each vocabulary used, the percentage values should sum 100%. For more information

vocabulary.hover_text: A code for a recognised vocabulary of terms classifying the event or action. This attribute is required. For more information

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: @vocabulary-uri

capital_spend.label: @percentage
capital_spend.hover_text: The percentage of the total commitment allocated to or planned for capital expenditure. Content must be a decimal number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign. For more information

activity_identifier.name: activity_identifier
activity_identifier.label: @ref
activity_identifier.hover_text: A valid activity identifier (as defined in iati-activity/iati-identifier).

relationship_type.name: relationship_type
relationship_type.label: @type
relationship_type.hover_text: An IATI code for the type of relationship

condition_attached.name: condition_attached
condition_attached.label: @attached
condition_attached.hover_text: A yes/no (1/0) value stating whether there are conditions attached to the activity. It is strongly recommended that this attribute is reported, even if there are no conditions attached (i.e. attached=”0”)

condition_type.name: condition_type
condition_type.label: @type
condition_type.hover_text: An IATI code defining the type of condition.

legacy_name.hover_text: The original field name in the reporting organisation’s system

value.name: value
value.label: @value
value.hover_text: The original field value in the reporting organisation’s system

iati_equivalent.name: iati_equivalent
iati_equivalent.label: @iati-equivalent
iati_equivalent.hover_text: The name of the equivalent IATI element.

date.hover_text: The date of publication of the document that is being linked to. For more information

contact_info.label: contact-info
contact_info.hover_text: Contact information for the activity. Specify whatever is available. You may repeat this element for each contact person. For more information

type.hover_text: The type of contact. See IATI codelist for values. This value must be of type xsd:string. For more information

job_title.label: job-title
job_title.hover_text: The job title of the contact person at the organisation. For more information

narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

telephone.name: telephone
telephone.label: telephone
telephone.hover_text: The contact telephone number. May be repeated for multiple numbers. For more information

email.name: email
email.label: email
email.hover_text: The contact email address. May be repeated for multiple addresses. For more information

website.name: website
website.label: website
website.hover_text: The contact web address. May be repeated for multiple sites. For more information

mailing_address.name: mailing_address
mailing_address.label: mailing-address
mailing_address.hover_text: The contact mailing address. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

location.name: location
location.label: location
location.hover_text: The sub-national geographical identification of the target locations of an activity. These can be described by gazetteer reference, coordinates, administrative areas or a textual description. Any number of locations may be reported. For more information

ref.name: ref
ref.label: @ref
ref.hover_text: An internal reference that describes the location in the reporting organisation’s own system. For more information

location_reach.name: location_reach
location_reach.label: location-reach
location_reach.hover_text: An IATI code for the geographic scope of the activity. This attribute is required. For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: An IATI code for the geographic scope of the activity. This attribute is required. For more information

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.label: location-id
location_id.hover_text: A unique code describing the location according to a recognised gazetteer or administrative boundary repository. Administrative areas should only be reported here if the location being defined is the administrative area itself. For describing the administrative area/s within which a more specific location falls the location/administrative element should be used. For more information

vocabulary.name: vocabulary
vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
vocabulary.hover_text: An IATI code for a recognised gazetteer or administrative boundary repository. This attribute is required. For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: A code from the gazetteer or administrative boundary repository specified by the vocabulary. For more information

name.name: name
name.label: name
name.hover_text: The human readable name for the location. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text: A description that qualifies the location, not the activity. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

activity_description.name: activity_description
activity_description.label: activity-description
activity_description.hover_text: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location. This should not duplicate information provided in the main activity description, and should typically be used to distinguish between activities at multiple locations within a single iati-activity record. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

administrative.name: administrative
administrative.label: administrative
administrative.hover_text: Coded identification of national and sub-national divisions according to recognised administrative boundary repositories. Multiple levels may be reported. For more information

vocabulary.name: vocabulary
vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
vocabulary.hover_text: An IATI code for a recognised administrative boundary repository. For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: The code for the administrative area being reported from the vocabulary specified. For more information

level.name: level
level.label: @level
level.hover_text: A number defining a subdivision within a hierarchical system of administrative areas. The precise system for defining the particular meaning of each @level value is determined by the @vocabulary being used. For more information

point.name: point
point.label: point
point.hover_text: The point element is based on a subset of the GML 3.3 Point element. For more information

srs_name.name: srs_name
srs_name.label: @srsName
srs_name.hover_text: The name of the spatial reference system used by the coordinates. For more information

pos.name: pos
pos.hover_text: The latitude and longitude coordinates in the format “lat lng”. For more information

exactness.name: exactness
exactness.label: exactness
exactness.hover_text: Defines whether the location represents the most distinct point reasonably possible for this type of activity or is an approximation due to lack of more detailed information. For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: A code from the Geographic Exactness Codelist. This attribute is required. For more information

location_class.name: location_class
location_class.label: location-class
location_class.hover_text: Whether the location refers to a structure, a populated place (e.g. city or village), an administrative division, or another topological feature (e.g. river, nature reserve). For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: A code from the Location Class codelist. This attribute is required. For more information

feature_designation.name: feature_designation
feature_designation.label: feature-designation
feature_designation.hover_text: A more refined coded classification of the type of feature referred to by this location. For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: A feature designation code form the authorised list (maintained by the US National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency). For more information

planned_disbursement_type.name: planned_disbursement_type
planned_disbursement_type.label: @type
planned_disbursement_type.hover_text: The purpose of planned-disbursement is to describe any predefined payment schedule. For more information

iso_date.name: iso_date
iso_date.label: @iso-date
iso_date.hover_text: The exact date of the planned disbursement OR the starting date of the period in which this specific disbursement will be made. For more information

iso_date.name: iso_date
iso_date.label: @iso-date
iso_date.hover_text: The ending date for the period in which this specific disbursement will be made. For more information

currency.name: currency
currency.label: @currency
currency.hover_text: A three letter ISO 4217 code for the original currency of the amount. This is required for all currency amounts unless the iati-organisation/@default-currency attribute is specified. For more information

value_date.name: value_date
value_date.label: @value-date
value_date.hover_text: The date to be used for determining the exchange rate for currency conversions.This attribute is required. For more information

ref.name: ref
ref.label: @ref
ref.hover_text: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. For more information

provider_activity_id.name: provider_activity_id
provider_activity_id.label: @provider-activity-id
provider_activity_id.hover_text: If incoming funds are being provided from the budget of another activity that is reported to IATI, it if STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that this should record the provider’s unique IATI activity identifier for that activity. For more information

type.name: type
type.label: @type
type.hover_text: The type of organisation providing the funds. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

ref.name: ref
ref.label: @ref
ref.hover_text: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. For more information.

receiver_activity_id.name: receiver_activity_id
receiver_activity_id.label: @receiver-activity-id
receiver_activity_id.hover_text: If outgoing funds are being provided to another activity that is reported to IATI, this may, if possible, record the unique IATI activity identifier for that activity. For more information

type.name: type
type.label: @type
type.hover_text: The type of organisation receiving the funds. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

organization_role.name: organization_role
organization_role.label: @role
organization_role.hover_text: An organisation involved with the activity. May be a donor, fund, agency, etc. Specifying the @ref identifier is strongly recommended. May contain the organisation name as narrative. If the reporting organisation plays a role in the activity it should be repeated here. One organisation may play more than one role (eg, funding and implementing): in such a case each role should be reported and the name of the organisation repeated. For more information

ref.name: ref
ref.label: @ref
ref.hover_text: Machine-readable identification string for the organisation issuing the report. Must be in the format {RegistrationAgency}-{RegistrationNumber} where {RegistrationAgency} is a valid code in the Organisation Registration Agency code list and {RegistrationNumber} is a valid identifier issued by the {RegistrationAgency}. If this is not present then the narrative MUST contain the name of the organisation. For more information

type.name: type
type.label: @type
type.hover_text: The type of organisation issuing the report. See IATI codelist for values. This value must be of type xsd:string. For more information

identifier.name: identifier
identifier.label: @activity-id
identifier.hover_text: A valid activity identifier published by the participating organisation which points to the activity that it has published to IATI that describes its role in this activity. This value must be of type xsd:string. For more information

crs_channel_code.name: crs_channel_code
crs_channel_code.label: @crs-channel-code
crs_channel_code.hover_text: Under CRS++ Reporting Directives this code identifies the implementing agency. Codes ending in ‘00’ are generic and are similar to the OrganisationType code. This value must be of type xsd:string. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

budget_status.name: budget_status
budget_status.label: @status
budget_status.hover_text: The status explains whether the budget being reported is indicative or has been formally committed. The value should appear within the BudgetStatus codelist. For more information

budget_type.name: budget_type
budget_type.label: @type
budget_type.hover_text: Whether this is the original budget (prepared when the original commitment was made) or has subsequently been revised. For more information

date.name: date
date.label: @iso-date
date.hover_text: This attribute is required. This value must be of type xsd:date. For more information

date.name: date
date.label: @iso-date
date.hover_text: This attribute is required. This value must be of type xsd:date. For more information

currency.name: currency
currency.label: @currency
currency.hover_text: A three letter ISO 4217 code for the original currency of the amount. This is required for all currency amounts unless the iati-organisation/@default-currency attribute is specified. For more information

value_date.name: value_date
value_date.label: @value-date
value_date.hover_text: The date to be used for determining the exchange rate for currency conversions.This attribute is required. For more information

type.name: type
type.label: @type
type.hover_text: An IATI code for the type of result being reported. For more information.

aggregation_status.name: aggregation_status
aggregation_status.label: @aggregation-status
aggregation_status.hover_text: Boolean flag indicating whether the data in the result set are suitable for aggregation. For more information.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The free text name or description of the item being described. This can be repeated in multiple languages. For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

url.hover_text: The target URL of the external document, e.g. http://www.example.org/doc.odt.For more information.

language.hover_text: ISO 639-1 language code. For more information

date.name: date
date.label: @iso-date
date.hover_text: The date of publication of the document that is being linked to. For more information

vocabulary.name: vocabulary
vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
vocabulary.hover_text: A code for the results framework vocabulary. The code must be a valid value in the ResultVocabulary codelist. For more information

code.name: code
code.label: @code
code.hover_text: A code from the codelist idenfitified in vocabulary that identifies a results framework. For more information

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: @vocabulary-uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: The URI where this vocabulary is defined. If the vocabulary is 99 (reporting organisation), the URI where this internal vocabulary is defined. While this is an optional field it is STRONGLY RECOMMENDED that all publishers use it to ensure that the meaning of their codes are fully understood by data users. For more information

measure.name: measure
measure.label: @measure
measure.hover_text: An IATI code defining the unit of measure in which the value is reported. For more information

ascending.name: ascending
ascending.label: @ascending
ascending.hover_text: A boolean describing the behaviour of the indicator. It is “true” if the indicator improves from small to large (e.g. clinics built); false if it improves from large to small (e.g. cases of a disease). For more information

aggregation_status.name: aggregation_status
aggregation_status.label: @aggregation-status
aggregation_status.hover_text: Boolean flag indicating whether the data in the result set are suitable for aggregation. For more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: The description of a sector defined by the reporting organisation. (Only to be used when the reporting organisation’s own vocabulary is being used). For more information

language.name: language
language.label: @xml:lang
language.hover_text: A code specifying the language of text in this element. It is recommended that wherever possible only codes from ISO 639-1 are used. If not present, the default language is assumed. For more information

flow_type.name: flow_type
flow_type.label: @code
flow_type.hover_text: A code from the OECD DAC CRS “Type of flow” codelist. For more information

finance_type.name: finance_type
finance_type.label: @code
finance_type.hover_text: A code from the OECD DAC CRS “Type of finance” codelist. For more information

aid_type_vocabulary.name: aid_type_vocabulary
aid_type_vocabulary.label: @vocabulary
aid_type_vocabulary.hover_text: A code for the vocabulary aid-type classifications. If omitted the AidType (OECD DAC) codelist is assumed. The code must be a valid value in the AidTypeVocabulary codelist. For more information

aid_type_code.name: aid_type_code
aid_type_code.label: @code
aid_type_code.hover_text: A code from the specified vocabulary. For more information

earmarking_category.name: earmarking_category
earmarking_category.label: @code
earmarking_category.hover_text: A code from the specified vocabulary. For more information

earmarking_modality.name: earmarking_modality
earmarking_modality.label: @code
earmarking_modality.hover_text: A code from the specified vocabulary. For more information

cash_and_voucher_modalities.label: @code
cash_and_voucher_modalities.name: cash_and_voucher_modalities
cash_and_voucher_modalities.hover_text: A code from the specified vocabulary. For more information

tied_status_code.name: tied_status_code
tied_status_code.label: @code
tied_status_code.hover_text: An IATI code interpreting the usage of Columns 36-38 of the CRS++ reporting format. (Amount tied, Amount partially untied, Amount tied). For more information
